com.pytsoft.cachelock.connector

Interface CacheClient

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MemcachedClient, RedisClient, RedisClusterClient

    public interface CacheClient
    The CacheClient interface defines the required commands for cache client to implement.

    Redis (with Jedis lib) , Redis cluster (with Jedis lib), and Memcached (with spymemcached lib) are implemented by default.

    The required commands for the cache client implementation are as follows:

    • setnx
    • hsetnx
    • get
    • hget
    • del
    • hdel

    Please reference the descriptions on each method for more information.

    Since:
    JDK 1.6
    Author:
    Ben PY Tarng
    See Also:
    RedisClient, RedisClusterClient, MemcachedClient

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static org.slf4j.Logger LOG 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void del(String key)
      Command DEL: delete key from cache server.
      String get(String key)
      Command GET: get value from key-value pair from cache server.
      void hdel(String key, String field)
      Command HDEL: delete field from hashed cache key.
      String hget(String key, String field)
      Command HGET: get value from field-value pair from hashed cache key.
      boolean hsetnx(String key, String field, String value, int expSeconds)
      Command HSETNX: set field-value pair to hashed key on cache server if field not exists.
      boolean setnx(String key, String value, int expSeconds)
      Command SETNX: set key-value pair to cache server if key not exists.

    • Field Detail

      • LOG

        static final org.slf4j.Logger LOG

    • Method Detail

      • setnx

        boolean setnx(String key,
              String value,
              int expSeconds)
        Command SETNX: set key-value pair to cache server if key not exists.
        Parameters:
        key - Cache key
        value - Value
        expSeconds - Lifetime for a key-value pair to exist on cache server
        Returns:
        True if key not exists and key-value pair set successfully

      • hsetnx

        boolean hsetnx(String key,
               String field,
               String value,
               int expSeconds)
        Command HSETNX: set field-value pair to hashed key on cache server if field not exists.
        Parameters:
        key - Cache key
        field - Hashed field in cache key
        value - Value
        expSeconds - Lifetime for a field-value pair to exist on hashed cache key
        Returns:
        True if field not exists and field-value pair hashed set successfully

      • get

        String get(String key)
        Command GET: get value from key-value pair from cache server.
        Parameters:
        key - Cache key
        Returns:
        Value stored in key-value pair

      • hget

        String hget(String key,
            String field)
        Command HGET: get value from field-value pair from hashed cache key.
        Parameters:
        key - Cache key
        field - Field in hashed cache key
        Returns:
        Value stored in field-value pair from hashed cache key

      • del

        void del(String key)
        Command DEL: delete key from cache server.
        Parameters:
        key - Cache key

      • hdel

        void hdel(String key,
          String field)
        Command HDEL: delete field from hashed cache key.
        Parameters:
        key - Cache key
        field - Field in hashed cache key
